intro: Sphaeralcea rusbyi subsp. gilensis, commonly known as Gil's globemallow, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its globular inflorescence, which consists of numerous yellow flowers clustered together. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and often fibrous stems.
